Home → New Chapters: Mental health information services → New you in 2015

New you in 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published Dec 30, 2014

Honestly healthy cleanse by Natasha Corrett

Mouth-watering recipes from gourmet vegetarian cook that will provide you with lots of energy.

5:2 your life: how the revolutionary 5:2 approach can transform your health, wealth and happiness by Emma Cook

The revolutionary principles of the 5:2 diet can be applied to key areas of your life, such as relationships, exercise, money, drinking, cultural life, screen time and technology, worry, and environment.

Natural superfoods by Susannah Blake

Helpful introduction to the nutritional benefits of our most well-known superfoods, including 150 family-friendly recipes.

Sugar-free cookbook by Davina McCall

Davina offers tips to banishing sugar from your life as well as offering recipes.

The belly fat cure fast track: discover the ultimate carb swap and drop up to 14 lbs. the first 14 days by Jorge Cruise

Doctor-approved, science-based diet includes recipes to avoid hidden sugars.

Eat, nourish, glow: 10 easy steps for losing weight, looking younger & feeling healthier by Amelia Freer

Nutritional therapist dispatches fad diets to the distant past, guiding you to a healthier future.

Just get on with it!: a caring, compassionate kick up the ass! by Ali Campbell

Real-life stories from Ali Campbell clients will help you to get honest with yourself about where you are and what you really want.

The positively present guide to life: how to make the most of every moment by Dani Dipirro

Practical guide inspiring how to be more ‘positively present’ at home, at work, in relationships and through times of change.

This book will make you mindful by Jessamy Hibberd and Jo Usmar

How to wind down and focus on each moment, enabling you to become more positive, confident and productive in everyday life. Draws on cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) research to help you deal with stress and anxiety effectively.

The 3 things that will change your destiny today by Paul McKenna

Simple process that anyone can do in hours, that gets you in touch with what you truly want and how to focus your mind and body to fulfil your destiny.

Brandon King

I work in the Suffolk Libraries Stock Team

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
